title: SK Moravská Slavia Brno
text:
SK Moravská Slavia Brno is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> club located in the city of <a href="Brno">Brno</a> in the <a href="South%20Moravian%20Region">South Moravian Region</a> of the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a>. The club currently plays in the South Moravian Regional Championship, the fifth tier of football in the Czech Republic.
The club played in the <a href="Czechoslovak%20First%20League">Czechoslovak First League</a>, the top flight of Czechoslovak football, in the <a href="1935%E2%80%9336%20Czechoslovak%20First%20League">1935–36 season</a>, as well as the subsequent <a href="1936%E2%80%9337%20Czechoslovak%20First%20League">1936–37 edition</a>. The club managed just one win from 22 matches in its final season in the Czechoslovak First League. The club merged with <a href="FC%20LeRK%20Brno">Sokol GZ Královo Pole</a> in 1949, ceasing to exist until its revival in 1965.
